medical_history.chief_complaint: Throbbing pain in the left ear and on the left side of the face, associated with fevers, neck stiffness, tinnitus, and weight loss.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 5 months before presentation, initially including fevers and throbbing pain in the left ear and face, radiating to the jaw. The fevers and neck stiffness resolved, but the ear and facial pain persisted and did not improve with acetaminophen. A 7 kg weight loss over 6 months was reported, attributed to dietary changes.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hypertension and dyslipidemia. Chronic dull pain in the left side of the abdomen for 30 years, episodic burning epigastric pain associated with diarrhea and Helicobacter pylori infection diagnosed 2 years prior.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of cancer or heart disease; several family members were exposed to tuberculosis.
medical_history.social_history: Non-smoker, does not drink alcohol, no illicit drug use. Lives in a small, rural town in Guatemala, working as a midwife, with dietary habits including consuming boiled fish, shrimp, and crayfish from local rivers.
